captions.text: Good morning, Hank, it's Friday.

It's actually Thursday, but tomorrow I'm going
to be in airports all day. Now I know what

you're saying, Hank: "But John, I can tell
by the gray speckled behind you that you are

currently in an airport". That's true, but
today I'm just in two airports. Tomorrow I'm

going to be in a ton of them. Ugh boy, I am
the sleepiest sleepyhead in Sleepslvania.

Do I have the vague resemblance of a Harry
Potter scar drawn on my forehead? No apologies.

So, Hank, today is the last day of pizzamas,
which means it is the last day that you can

buy any of these things with my mustachio-ed
face on them. So if you want a glow-in-the-dark

Pizza John shirt or a David Bowie Pizza John
shirt or if you want to dress your baby in

a Pizza John onesie, today is the last day.
Link in the dooblydoo.

In other news, I'm very, very tired. Cara
Delevingne, Nat Wolff and I did our modeling
faces yesterday.

Hank, we've all been practicing our model
faces, Cara has a pretty good one. It's so

funny! I can't-- it's so great! Alright, Nat
has a pretty good one.
Nat: Normal. (everybody laughs)

John: No! It's better when you try, it's better
when you try. Your sincere model face.
Nat: I can't do the cheek thing.
Cara: No, you just suck it in.
John: No.. you-u-you-op..
Nat: What do I do?

John: You open your mouth a little bit...
(laughter) THAT ONE! That one is a good one!
Nat: Was it really good?

John: No! So this is my normal face. And this
is my model face.. like...
Nat: So subtle. Yeah!
Cara: I like the soft attitude.

John: Hank, everyone involved in the Paper
Towns movie is doing such a great job, and

I don't know how they do it, because the hours
are incredibly long. Like, all I'm doing is

like sitting in a chair, eating peanut M&Ms,
laughing and crying, as all these hardworking

people bring this story to life. And yet,
despite the ridiculous easiness of my job,

I am truly the most fatigued, fatigued person
in all of Fatiguedville.

So anyway, thank you to everyone in the Paper
Towns crew who's going to stay up until five

o'clock in the morning tonight, because that
is... oh boy, I don't know how you're going

to do it. Oh, Nerdfighters, I also want to
say thanks for your feedback on Project for

Awesome 2014, I will talk more about that
when I'm not the most exhausted exhaustee
in all of Exhaustia.

And Hank, I also wanted to say that I really
enjoyed Pizzamassing with you. It's made me

feel like uhh.. I don't know! It's just been
really fun. Good ol' days kind of feeling.

You know what would also be fun, Hank? Going
to sleep! And fortunately, I'm about to be

on a giant steel cylinder that will hurtle
hundreds of miles through the thin and unsurvivable

atmosphere, 30,000 feet above sea level. And
that's just the kind of environment I'd like
to sleep in.

Oookay Hank! I didn't really believe in myself,
but I did get some sleep on the flight, now

I am in Los Angeles. Earlier today, I got
to be with Shailene Woodley and Ansel Elgort

and lots of other people involved in The Fault
in our Stars movie. As an Amsterdam-esque

Fault in our Stars bench was installed on
the Fox lot.

The Fox lot has a statue of Napoleon Dynamite
and murals of The Simpsons and Star Wars...

and to join that kind of company is just uhh..
It's pretty wonderful. And now, I am going

to go to bed-- is what I would like to say,
but in fact, I am going to go to the airport.
Hank, you'll see me on Tuesday.

P.S, Nerdfighters, the AFC Wimbly Womblies
have just played the most important games

in their history! Link's in the doobly doo!
Or you can click overr... here...

comments.text:
Today is 9:13 pm on November 24th, 2014. Upon finishing this video, I have 
successfully accomplished my goal of watching every single vlogbrothers 
video that has been uploaded so far. I found this community over the summer 
and I fell in love with the values and the sense of community that John and 
Hank created in Nerdfighteria. I am truly proud to be able to call myself a 
nerdfighter. Thank you John and Hank for creating this channel and forming 
a community that is in a way almost like my family. DFTBA. ﻿

comments.text:
Hello. I just watched (30 seconds ago) a video from Ze Frank about not 
being able to take a plane. When I see one of your videos, usually it makes 
me feel good, because there are still people in this world who try to make 
it better for everybody, and not themselves. With Ze is similar, but with 
him I almost always end up wanting to cry. He's too deep for me, or maybe 
his videos just are about or close to my problems and fears, and make me 
think about my shortcomings. Anyway, thanks for your work.﻿

comments.author: WashuOtaku

comments.text:
The reason you are fatigued is probably just because you just sit there. 
Gotta get some physical and/or mental workout in every day or your body 
will set itself to a kind of standby mode, causing the exhaustion you're 
experiencing when you try to force it back into action. I get that you 
can't be running around while you're on set, but you could bring a 
crossword onto the set and solve it while your attention isn't required, I 
know that kind of thing helped me while I was working in 3d design and had 
to babysit our rendering farm for 5 days while it was processing the final 
shots for a project.﻿
